#summary Authenticating and Authorization of AeManagers

= Creating a AeProxy user/password account =
  # Log onto the AeProxy host
  # Add the user to the system with the command: _sudo java -cp ./usr/local/bin/AeProxy.jar org.tbrt.ae.AeAuthentication -add USERNAME _ where USERNAME is the name of the user account to create.
  # At the password prompt enter the user's password

= Granting access to the AeProxy to a Google User =
  # Log onto the AeProxy host
  # Add the user to the system with the command: _sudo java -cp ./usr/local/bin/AeProxy.jar org.tbrt.ae.AeAuthentication -auth USERNAME _ where USERNAME is the name of the user account created above.

= Creating a user/password account for an authorized user of AeProxy =
  # Log onto the AeProxy host
  # Add the user to the system with the command: _sudo java -cp ./usr/local/bin/AeProxy.jar org.tbrt.ae.AeAuthentication -auth GOOGLE_EMAIL_ADDRESS _ where GOOGLE_EMAIL_ADDRESS is the user's google email address.
